topic.title: Why does God punish us?
topic.body: Many times some of us have been in pain or put through injustices for which there is no restitution. If God cares, why are these things happening?

1565095300_1PnHUGmQkYq4NKZBxFp8o1Wb1ZZij.body:
The protesters are very brave and have scored some sort of victory by shaking Mrs Lam and her new bill off course. Now is the time for those opposed to the bill to consider negotiations and they should be mindful of warnings from China's central government. If the protesters push too far with destructive disturbances they may lose public sympathy and lose an opportunity to re-direct Hong Kong's future to a palatable outcome.

   China would do well to consider allowing Hong Kong to stay eccentric from the state council : it may have an unforeseen benefit to the CCP if it acquiesces on this matter.

*Twitter closes 936+ accounts created in China to upset Hong Kong's citizens*

---

Information operations directed at Hong Kong

We are disclosing a significant state-backed information operation focused on the situation in Hong Kong, specifically the protest movement and their calls for political change.

What we are disclosing
This disclosure consists of 936 accounts originating from within the People’s Republic of China (PRC). Overall, these accounts were deliberately and specifically attempting to sow political discord in Hong Kong, including undermining the legitimacy and political positions of the protest movement on the ground. Based on our intensive investigations, we have reliable evidence to support that this is a coordinated state-backed operation. Specifically, we identified large clusters of accounts behaving in a coordinated manner to amplify messages related to the Hong Kong protests.

continued : https://blog.twitter.com/en_us/topics/company/2019/information_operations_directed_at_Hong_Kong.html

---

> [numismatist](#comment_43_1F8BHc6FztvWRy9cttVXLj22DSSvMdbGy): So wait, now Twitter’s banning accounts which they deem upsetting? 

I believe there is a trend for social media organisations to disallow multiple accounts whose only purpose is fraud. Government propaganda falls into this category in this instance. Interestingly Twitter is a proscribed site in China and really the Politburo of the CCP should applaud and thank Twitter for enforcing their own legislation. 



If they have banned the site already they can hardly complain can they, when they have their accounts shut down.
It is over? Did the protesters get what they wanted?

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
> [hackermobs](#comment_2_1AHZ7t3mynNFD7giEo86Pm93nCBjJEhtRo): Can anyone check if my zite is running properly? [...]


   CONNECTING...
TRACKERS ANNOUNCING: 0, ERROR: 0, DONE: 13
NO PEERS FOUND

Good afternoon.

   I would like to create a .bit page for ZeroNet. I am currently buying a namecoin. Is this correct?

Thank you for your help in this matter.

ZeroNet vulnerability fix
A serious ZeroNet Vulnerability has been found. To patch your client, go to this ZeroTalk topic, created and backed by krixano, gitcenter, thunder and zerolstn:

:/

>Cannot send to nick/channel
None of it ever bloody works. Amateurs. No documentation, half finished developments, unhelpful error handling. I give up. I want a proper thing. That does something. And keeps doing it.

> [watteau](#comment_38_1AM6ZY48ErJLzU89E7wPVjxoqyWuFnk33o): None of it ever bloody works. Amateurs. No documentation, half finished developments, unhelpful error handling. I give up. I want a proper thing. That does something. And keeps doing it.

freeware ville

> [gitcenter](#comment_540_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): It does, you're using ZeroTalk after all.

Which has a broken menu bar :/

> [gitcenter](#comment_540_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di):  ZeroBlog's work, don't they?

I don't know. I'm buying a namecoin so apparently I will get to have a .bit page, but I don't want a ZeroBlog. Nor do I want to learn Python. *humpfh*

> [gitcenter](#comment_540_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Nothing can be finished, it can only be dead. You can't say "we're done", because there are always more features to implement.

When a painting is framed it is perfect and there is no more to be done. Once the executable is compiled it should be exquisitely sealed forever.

> [gitcenter](#comment_541_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Zite developers don't have to learn Python. They aren't even required to know JavaScript. Pure HTML (+CSS) works too.

Brilliant! Thanks for the information.

> [gitcenter](#comment_541_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Does it? Works fine for me.

Try clicking on · Français · , the language menu bar then disappears.

I'm buying a namecoin, but then how do I give it to the .bit domain manger for my page? Do I put it into my namecoin wallet then send it with namecoin-qt.exe? The wallet doesn't appear to be persistent. I wonder how the coin trader sends me my coin? 

It's all very sketchy.

> [gitcenter](#comment_543_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di):  [...] software. Software is used by different people, and they all may have problems with it, or [...].

It's just irresistible.

> [gitcenter](#comment_544_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Unfortunately, I haven't used Namecoin, but there are a couple of tutorials here on ZeroTalk.

Thanks. I will keep you updated. Currently at 11.90 ZAR per coin.

If the anticipation is that sterling will stay weak and grow weaker an international currency dealer could borrow in sterling and once it has lowered in value, pay off the borrowed amount at a cheaper rate. Another potential action is that UK stocks valued in GBP are lowering in value comparatively and some stocks and entire companies may become attractive for market shoppers.

It's only recently that I've started paying a close interest, do correct me if I am wrong.

USD / CNY
7.0558

This is quite historic. United States of America dollars will now buy 7.055 Yuan. 

The people of America now have a greater buying power for Chinese goods, hopefully this should take some of the pressure off of American consumers after the improvised trading tariffs that were recently introduced.

Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas cut their interest rates last week by .25% to 4.25%.

Amongst a trend of countries also reducing interest rates which include India, New Zealand and Thailand.
The Philippines economy grew by 5.5% last quarter and sounds more favourable comparatively than the UK which saw a contraction in its economy by .2% in the same quarter.

Business news. Verizon Media Group has sold Tumblr to Automattic Inc, the owner of WordPress. Incidentally Tumblr's unique visits per month have shrunk by nearly 40% since 2016; could it be that Automattic will use the purchase to persuade Tumblr's customers to migrate to one of its other brands?

USA yields on bonds and UK yields on gilts inverted between the two year and ten year and thirty year choice of investments. A long term investment is paying less than a short term investment. 

This story has been reported before so potentially it's a harmless fluctuation. News services ever keen on disaster believe it heralds a recession.

There is some evidence in this with the UK contraction in growth last quarter , but if the UK leaves the EU without any trading agreements in place this autumn, absolutely anything could happen! 

By way of a digression Germany does have an economy that is in slowdown.

"There are fewer and fewer positive-yielding assets to park cash in globally" supposes Richard Kelly, the head of global strategy at *Toronto-Dominion Bank*.








Invest in oil painting.
Gold is at a six year high.

I read today that the UK government is increasing its borrowing. What I find odd is the reduction in yields for gilts. I would have thought that if the UK economy is becoming one of raising capital through borrowing then gilt yields would be more attractive to increase private investment into government coffers. What sets the rates on gilts and bonds? The amount available and the uptake of them? The central bank itself? Curious.

Scotland were it a unique country ought technically be refused membership of the European Union as when considered individual from Great Britain its economy has a deficit between income and borrowings of 7% of GDP.  The European Union standard is 3% of GDP.
1 Argentine Peso equals 0.018 United States Dollar 1 United States Dollar equals 0.81 Pound sterling 1 Pound sterling equals 1.12 Euro

1565677270_1F8BHc6FztvWRy9cttVXLj22DSSvM.body:
Argentina is currently in recession, it also has a peculiarly high inflation rate (22%) that probably makes life even harder for Argentinians on middle to low incomes. President Mauricio Macri's government had been implementing austerity measures (that inflation rate was previously 58%!)  and he was seen as a stable choice by the markets (that's people and companies buying currency and stocks and bonds nationally and internationally). 

All this has changed with the Argentinian primaries where President Mauricio Macri was looking for a second term. The primaries are the first hurdle where the potential candidates are selected to run against each other. President Macri has performed badly against Señor Alberto Fernández, who is running with ex-President Cristina Fernández as leaders of a left wing coalition party Frente de Todos.

That Frente de Todos gains power and Cristina comes back to govern Argentinian politics really upset the markets and the drop in the Peso's value was dramatic. From 42 peso to buy a dollar, not anymore it was last at 53 ARS to a USD. Share prices in some Argentinian companies have also dropped by nearly 50%. Do you want to buy Argentinian?

Presidencia de la Nación
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMm5KnY62So

Palabras del señor presidente Mauricio Macri



205,802 views

1.7K Up

1K Down

Casa Rosada - República Argentina
Streamed live 9 hours ago
Palabras del señor presidente Mauricio Macri
Category
News & Politics

Starts at 2:32 after a minimalist bleep track.

Reading further on Argentinian politics, a lot of the financial problems of Argentina are blamed on Señor Fernández's running partner Cristina Fernández de Kirchner and her presidency with the Justicialist Party and Frente para la Victoria. 

"... de Kirchner is corrupt, and an erratic economic manager" - *Benjamin Gedan* (Argentina project, Wilson Center)

Ex-president Christina de Kirchner has been indicted in 11 corruption cases and is blamed by most economists for Argentina's financial woes. 

Yet the Argentinean people possibly will let her run the controls of their economy again. No wonder the markets made like they had an aneurysm. President Macri who was elected in 2015 was slowly getting the economy together and had brought the eye-watering 50%+ inflation down to a quite high 22% , it is not good enough and the people seemingly want chaos instead.

Argentina's economic minister Nicolas Dujovne has resigned because of the crisis from the drop in value of the Peso after the first presidential run. Paradoxically that drop was caused by the possibility of Dujovne and his government losing the election. Maybe his resignation will help to keep President Macri in power. 

If not the international financial world is expecting disaster.

The Argentine Republic is South America's second largest and the world's eighth largest country. The Andes range in the east contains Mount Aconcagua, the highest peak in the Americas. In the south, the Andes overlook Patagonia, an arid plateau region. In the east-central Argentina lies a fertile, well-watered plain called the *pampas*. Temperatures vary from subtropical to temperate.

**Argentina poll returns Peronists to power with Fernández victory**

Argentina's Peronists returned to power, defeating the pro-market Mauricio Macri in the presidential election. Former cabinet chief Alberto Fernández received 48 per cent of the vote, giving him an outright first-round victory.
   But his victory was not as comfortable as predicted, suggesting voter unease about the return to power of running mate Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, president in 2007-15.
   The Peronist victory underlines the revival of Latin America's left. Populist leftwinger Evo Morales is back at the helm in Bolivia, and protesters in Chile have been demanding higher wages and pensions, forcing the centre-right cabinet to quit. "The times ahead will not be easy," Mr Fernández said.

1566357785_1GQMHdkj67rAzy1uMbq5Smvhg9o4Y.body:
I am in quite a worrying financial position and also in physical discomfort. The good news is that my financial deficit should improve my well being by limiting my spending on intoxicants yet the stress has to be factored in as well. Certainly a good diet and gentle exercise will get me through the next quarter and my visit to the surgery cannot be put off, hopefully thy can diagnose and relieve my malady. I have made a very good work, which is still a delight to me and I am eager to visit the workshop in the town west of my abode for the finishing of my craft. 

I seem to be in tandem with the political and economic circumstances of my heimat and I pray for a life long enough to reach the highlands of perfect peace and fulfilment.
